svg.text: * Accumulators, scalability of UTXO blockchains, and data availability
* Ethereum Probabilistic Micropayments by Gustav Simonsson for Orchid
* Eth gas reporter : mocha test reporter with gas usage per unit test
* Golang client library to communicate with Eth RPC
* Ethereum cross chain atomic swaps using hashed time-lock contracts from ETC core dev
* Truffle Flattener : merge your code written with Truffle in the right order
* Reduce gas use with async tx using Oraclize
* Ethereal - basic command line interface for a few common things, eg increasing gas
* ethers.js - a web3 alternative from L4 and Richard Moore
* Our “Blockchain Powered Mobiilty Future” Money20/20 video from Oaken & Toyota
* Links for all the EthWaterloo finalists . TrueBit’s recap video .
* Basic Attention Token partnership with DuckDuckGo - A natural combination. I’ve
already been partnering their use for months
* More progress on the r/Ethtrader DAO token .
* Vote in CoinDesk’s Most Influential People in Blockchain . You don’t need an email
address to vote, it takes less than 2 minutes, and I don’t want to lose to Paris
* FunFair is live on Rinkeby and Kovan using the TESTFUN token
* Gnosis will hold a prediction market tournament
* Melon v0.4 front end UI on IPFS
* Giveth on their transparent donation flow - alpha live on testnet
* Fragmented : A decentralized social network for Ethereum enthusiasts
* Quickblocks – fast and customizable data . first of 3 papers.
* Viktor Tron on Swarm at Eth London Meetup
* Print Q&A with Niklas Kunkel from MakerDAO
* Esteban Ordano video intro of Decentraland’s editor
* Arthur Falls has ended the Ether Review. Here’s episode 1 of his new Third Web
podcast on scalability. He’s pretty skeptical of Ethereum’s scalability.
* Vinay Gupta talk on funding a Mars mission
* The Bitcoin Podcast talks to Sweetbridge
* Rhys Lindmark interviews USV’s Albert Wenger and Jordan Leigh
* MrYukonC interview with Aion CEO Matt Spoke
* Berlin meetup – OmiseGo, Joseph Poon on Plasma, Qubes, Streamr
* Jake Brukhman: “ Fat protocols are not an investment thesis ” and Alex Bulkin
Protocols or apps? Put an end to useless heuristics . CoinFund largely agrees with my
“ There’s no such thing as "fat protocols” post
* Ryan Selkis announces Messari , an EDGAR-like database for cryptoassets
* Airswap notes that 80% of Philippine accounts were farmed. That’s not the only
* Cofound.it evaluator program : crowd sourcing the evaluation of potential Cofound.it
* Watch the SEC session on blockchains from Oct 12
* Nathan Popper in the NYTimes: How Floyd Mayweather Helped Two Young Guys From Miami
Get Rich in ICO . Fred Wilson reaction to Popper’s article: I Scam Yous
* How the ZEP Token Powers zeppelinOS
* This week in celeb ICO shilling was futbol (soccer) heavy: manager Harry Redknapp and
* Props project: real time many-to-many video is the next frontier
* Dilbert’s Scott Adams is doing a token sale for WhenHub
* A video demo of Virtue Poker
* DFINITY launches their testnet . 12 minute video demo
* Airbitz is renaming themselves Edge and adding Ethereum
* A Brief History of P2P Content Distribution , in 10 Major Events
* Vitalik isn’t involved in anything involving Catalonia or their independence. Fake
* Ethereal summit morning talks . And video of afternoon . Or go directly to Joseph
* After attending Ethereal, Techcrunch’s Jon Evans gave a sober if slightly pessimistic
WARNING : list may include or even likely includes scams and quasi-scams . Do your own
research and due diligence before putting value at risk. Read disclaimer below.
Want to be included ? If you are building your project on Ethereum, email
weekinethereum @ gmail [period] com with 1) your URL, 2) sale date and 3) a brief but
convincing description of how you are using Ethereum, preferably with a link to your
Github repo. Listings are free . But please make sure to follow those instructions .
If you don’t follow the instructions, you likely won’t get a response.
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as
to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether
any will produce a satisfactory return. I have passed the CFA exams , but this is not
investment advice. If you’re interested in what I do, you can find my somewhat
out-of-date investing thesis and token sale appreciation strategies in previous
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys.
I’m thankful that ConsenSys has brought me on as an employee and given me time to do
My charge from Joe Lubin is pretty similar to what Status has told me: keep telling the
truth and covering the space as objectively as I can.
Editorial control is 100% me. Blame me first and last.
Thanks for reading. Every week I put an amount of time into this newsletter that even I
can hardly believe, so many thanks for making it worthwhile.
I’d love it if you shared this newsletter.
This newsletter is supported by Status.im and ConsenSys (surely you have seen that
we’re hiring ?). Many thanks to both.
